Package com.library.backend.services.admin

Class AdministratorBooksService

java.lang.Object
com.library.backend.services.admin.AdministratorBooksService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Service
public class AdministratorBooksService extends Object implements Service
The AdministratorBooksService class provides functionality for managing book inventories and associated book forms within the administration module. It includes methods for searching book inventories, removing inventories, updating book forms, and retrieving all book inventories.

Example Usage: 

 
 // Create an AdministratorBooksService instance with BookInventoryRepository and BookFormRepository
 AdministratorBooksService booksService = new AdministratorBooksService(BookInventoryRepository.getInstance(), BookFormRepository.getInstance());

 // Search for book inventories based on a string
 String searchString = "Java Programming";
 Collection<BookInventory> searchResults = booksService.searchBookInventory(searchString);

 // Remove a book inventory
 BookInventory inventoryToRemove = // obtain a BookInventory instance;
 booksService.removeInventory(inventoryToRemove);

 // Retrieve all book inventories
 List<BookInventory> allInventories = booksService.getAllBookInventories();
In this example, an AdministratorBooksService instance is created with the necessary repositories, and various methods are used to search, remove, and retrieve book inventories.

The AdministratorBooksService class implements the Service interface, providing a common interface for various services in the application.

  • Method Details

    • searchBookInventory

      public Collection<BookInventory> searchBookInventory(String searchString) throws SearchEngineException
      Searches for book inventories based on the provided string using the configured SearchEngine.
      Parameters:
      searchString - The string to search for in book inventories.
      Returns:
      A collection of book inventories matching the search criteria.
      Throws:
      SearchEngineException - If there is an issue with the search engine.

    • removeInventory

      public void removeInventory(BookInventory inventory)
      Removes the specified BookInventory along with its associated book forms.
      Parameters:
      inventory - The BookInventory instance to be removed.

    • updateBookForms

      public void updateBookForms(List<Book> bookList)
      Updates the associated BookForms by removing specified books.
      Parameters:
      bookList - The list of books to be removed from book forms.

    • getAllBookInventories

      public List<BookInventory> getAllBookInventories()
      Retrieves all BookInventories from the repository.
      Returns:
      A list containing all book inventories.
